workflows, supporting tasks like code generation. However, while these models often 
generate functionally correct outputs, we still lack a systematic understanding and

title: Scaling Security Testing by Addressing the Reachability Gap
data:
G Sapia, M Bhme - 2026
In order to scale automated security testing, we must first solve the reachability gap. 
Existing approaches to test specific features of a software system always assume 
some way of interacting with the system. For instance, the most popular approach, 
fuzzing, either assumes command line access, network access, an execution to 
amplify, or so-called fuzz drivers to send generated inputs to the system's process or 
its components. Yet, scaling security testing requires so much more than sending
Cites: AutoCodeRover: Autonomous program improvement

title: Deploying Lightweight Input-Aware Selective Instruction Duplication in HPC Applications
data:
MH Rahman, G Li- Proceedings of the International Conference for High, 2025
Modern high-performance computing (HPC) applications are increasingly vulnerable 
to silent data corruptions (SDCs) caused by transient hardware faults. While selective 
instruction duplication (SID) offers an efficient software-level protection strategy, 
existing SID methods rely on SDC vulnerability profile derived from only the default 
reference input often found in application suites. However, they overlook the input-
dependent nature of SDC propagation. This leads to significant SDC coverage loss
Cites: Coverage-based greybox fuzzing as markov chain
